definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: Fig. 5 depicts the Southern Hemisphere midlatitude 300-hPa geopotential height field.
sentences.chinese: 圖5給出南半球中緯度300百帕位勢高度場。

sentences.english: The SKA will be built in the southern hemisphere with South Africa and Australia currently vying for the right to host the project.
sentences.chinese: 她又南非與澳大利亞共同組建，目前坐落於南半球。

sentences.english: A constellation in the equatorial region of the Southern Hemisphere near Aquarius and Eridanus.
sentences.chinese: 鯨魚座南半球赤道地區靠近寶瓶座與波江座的星座。

sentences.english: Billie lives in the southern hemisphere.
In the Southern Hemisphere, 2009 wasthe warmest year on record.
sentences.chinese: 在南半球，2009年則是其記錄上最溫暖的一年了。

sentences.english: In the Southern Hemisphere, it's called aurora australis , or southern lights.
sentences.chinese: 在南半球，它的所謂南極光，或是南部燈。

sentences.english: But in the Southern Hemisphere, drought dominated the decade.
sentences.chinese: 而在南半球，這十年間乾旱肆虐。

sentences.english: Asymmetric auroral intensities in the Earth's Northern and Southern hemispheres .
sentences.chinese: 北半球和南半球的不對稱極光強度。

sentences.english: In the Southern Hemisphere, 2009 was the warmest year on record.
sentences.chinese: 在南半球，2009年則是其記錄上最溫暖的一年了。

sentences.english: They are only found in the oceans of the southern hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 人們只能在南半球的海洋裏看到南露脊鯨。

sentences.english: That makes 2009 the warmest year on record in that hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 這使得2009年成爲南半球歷史上最熱的一年。

sentences.english: It follows a regime of survival skills derived originally from Bushmen of the southern hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 它遵循一系列源於南半球布希曼人的生存技術。

sentences.english: This photogenic nebula can be seen in the south with even a small telescope.
sentences.chinese: 這張照片中的星雲可在南半球用小型的望遠鏡來觀賞。

sentences.english: Geographically, this country is located in the southern hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 在地理上，這個國家位於南半球。

definition: equator (of the earth or astronomical body)
Sydney, capital of New South Wales, Australia
the North Pole/the Arctic Pole/the north magnetic pole
